history.content:
Have you ever tried to access a government resource like Cal Fresh? If you have, there's a good chance you found that the process is unnecessarily complicated and frustrating. If you haven't you can see what it's like here: http://www.ca.gov/Agencies/Social-Services-Department-of/Agency-Services/Apply-for-Food-Stamps

What if instead of having to click through outdated, difficult websites to access government services, you could just go to a website like getcalfresh.org and fill out a quick, easy, intuitive form. That's the mission of Code for America: to make government work for the people, by the people in the 21st century. 

Code for America has Brigades all over the country. Brigades are volunteer groups that collaborate with local government and community partners to build new tools that help with local civic issues. A few students at UC Berkeley are in the process of creating a new brigade: Code for Berkeley. 

You don't have to be a coder to join us. If you know how to code - great! If you don't - great! By bringing together people with a wide range of skills - including design, coding, policy, and more - we hope to make great products and help each other learn. If you're interested in joining us on our mission to improve how people interact with government in Berkeley, please fill out this form and we'll be in touch as soon as we have more details. 

tl;dr
We need your help to make government better using technology and user-centered design.
☹️ http://www.ca.gov/…/S…/Agency-Services/Apply-for-Food-Stamps
😊 getcalfresh.org

To learn more about Code for America, visit their website at www.codeforamerica.org. If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to reach out to us at codeforberkeley@gmail.com. 

Interest Form: https://goo.gl/forms/xfI13S8xfUv2P6623
history.subject: Use your CS skills to improve government
